title: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei
text:
The United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (UNISFA) is a <a href="United%20Nations">United Nations</a> <a href="peacekeeping">peacekeeping</a> force in <a href="Abyei">Abyei</a>, which is contested between the <a href="Republic%20of%20Sudan">Republic of Sudan</a> and the <a href="Republic%20of%20South%20Sudan">Republic of South Sudan</a>. UNISFA was approved on 27 June 2011 by the <a href="United%20Nations%20Security%20Council">United Nations Security Council</a> in <a href="United%20Nations%20Security%20Council%20Resolution%201990">United Nations Security Council Resolution 1990</a> after a flareup in the <a href="South%20Kordofan%20conflict">South Kordofan conflict</a> earlier in June 2011. The <a href="Ethiopian%20Army">Ethiopian Army</a> is the largest contributor of personnel, and as of 2018, the only contributor of individual troops.
Command.
UNISFA is run by a Head of Mission and a Force Commander. In the operation's initial years, these positions were held by the same person, but since 2014 they have been split between two people. Since 28 January 2015, the Head of Mission has been <a href="Haile%20Tilahun%20Gebremariam">Haile Tilahun Gebremariam</a>. Since April 2018, the Force Commander has been Major General <a href="Gebre%20Adhana%20Woldezgu">Gebre Adhana Woldezgu</a>.
Contributing countries.
As of 31 May 2018, the total number of personnel in the mission is 4,571, all but a little over 100 of whom are Ethiopian.
